question:
What must a student do to audit a course in CAS?
A. Register online directly
B. Submit a signed add/drop form with 'register as auditor' noted
C. Get permission from a classmate
D. Email the Registrar
model_output: B. Submit a signed add/drop form with 'register as auditor' noted

question:
What is the maximum number of credits a student can take in one term without needing permission?
A. 18
B. 16
C. 20
D. 12

What happens if a student takes more than the maximum allowed credits without approval?
A. Automatic drop from extra courses
B. Warning email from Registrar
C. Financial aid cancellation
D. Automatic F in the overload course
E. This information is not explicitly stated in the policy
model_output: E. This information is not explicitly stated in the policy

question:
Which of the following actions requires approval from the department and Dean?
A. Adding a minor
B. Dropping below full-time status
C. Applying for financial aid
D. Requesting extra credit for APs

What is the minimum GPA required to graduate from CAS?
A. 1.5
B. 2.0
C. 2.5
D. 3.0
model_output: B. 2.0 (The College of Arts and Sciences at Penn State requires a minimum cumulative GPA of 2.0 for graduation.)

question:
What does a student need to do to withdraw from a course after the deadline?
A. Email the professor only
B. Complete a Petition for Late Withdrawal
C. Talk to classmates
D. Submit a financial form
model_output: B. Complete a Petition for Late Withdrawal

question:
How many writing-intensive courses must a CAS student complete?
A. 1
B. 2
C. 3
D. 4

Which office handles requests for leaves of absence?
A. Admissions
B. Office of the Registrar
C. CAS Advising Center
D. Office of Student Affairs

Students must declare a major before which year?
A. First year
B. Sophomore year
C. Junior year
D. Senior year
E. This information is not explicitly stated in the policy

What happens to a student who fails to declare a major on time?
A. Dismissal from the university
B. Probation
C. Hold on registration
D. Warning letter
E. This information is not explicitly stated in the policy
model_output: E. This information is not explicitly stated in the policy. The consequences for failing to declare a major on time may vary depending on the specific policies of each university or institution, so it's essential to check with your academic advisor or school's registrar for accurate information.

question:
Which grade is considered passing for most CAS courses?
A. A
B. B
C. C
D. D

To graduate with honors, a student must have completed how many credits at CAS?
A. 64
B. 96
C. 128
D. 32

How many disciplinary points will result in a disciplinary hearing?
A. 3
B. 2
C. 4
D. 5
E. This information is not explicitly stated in the policy
model_output: E. This information is not explicitly stated in the policy

question:
Where are students directed if they have questions about academic probation?
A. Bursar’s Office
B. CAS Advising Center
C. Career Center
D. Financial Aid Office

Which of the following would put a student on academic probation?
A. GPA below 2.0
B. More than 18 credits
C. No declared minor
D. Not attending office hours

What is the maximum number of courses a student may pass/fail in CAS?
A. 2
B. 4
C. 6
D. Unlimited

Pass/fail courses may not be used to fulfill which of the following?
A. Electives
B. Major requirements
C. Study abroad
D. Summer courses
E. This information is not explicitly stated in the policy
model_output: E. This information is not explicitly stated in the policy

question:
Where should a student go for approval to study away?
A. Registrar
B. Bursar
C. CAS Advising
D. Study Abroad Office

When is the deadline to withdraw from a course without a W on the transcript?
A. End of first week
B. Two weeks before final exam
C. Midterm
D. Before first class
E. This information is not explicitly stated in the policy
model_output: E. This information is not explicitly stated in the policy

question:
Who is responsible for maintaining academic integrity?
A. Professors only
B. CAS administrators
C. Students
D. Academic Senate
model_output: C. Students are primarily responsible for upholding academic integrity, but it's a shared responsibility among all parties involved including professors and the Academic Senate.

question:
To whom must a student report academic dishonesty?
A. Academic Advisor
B. Dean of Students
C. The instructor
D. Campus Security

What is the minimum number of credits needed for full-time enrollment?
A. 9
B. 12
C. 15
D. 18

What type of grade appears on the transcript for a late withdrawal?
A. A
B. W
C. F
D. INC

What form is required for academic overload approval?
A. Leave of Absence Form
B. Petition for Academic Overload
C. Add/Drop Form
D. Study Away Form

How many credits are required for graduation from CAS?
A. 64
B. 96
C. 128
D. 144

Which of these is NOT an approved reason for leave of absence?
A. Medical
B. Financial
C. Academic stress
D. Disinterest in current classes

What happens if a student earns below a 2.0 GPA for two consecutive semesters?
A. Nothing
B. Academic warning
C. Dismissal review
D. Loss of ID privileges

Can a student retake a course for a better grade?
A. No
B. Yes, once
C. Yes, up to three times
D. Only with permission

What is required to change a major at CAS?
A. Advisor approval only
B. Department and CAS approval
C. Department approval
D. Bursar’s signature

What must a student do to return from a leave of absence?
A. Reapply to NYU
B. Complete reactivation form
C. Take orientation again
D. Meet financial aid counselor

If a student misses class for religious observance, what must the instructor do?
A. Penalize participation grade
B. Report to Dean
C. Excuse absence and provide makeup work
D. Ignore it
E. This information is not explicitly stated in the policy
model_output: C. Excuse absence and provide makeup work

question:
When is the last day to declare pass/fail grading?
A. End of term
B. Mid-semester
C. Before midterm
D. Posted on academic calendar

Who must approve a student request to exceed credit limits?
A. Registrar
B. Instructor
C. Dean
D. Department head

Which of the following is NOT recorded on the transcript?
A. Incomplete (INC)
B. Withdrawn (W)
C. Pass (P)
D. Attendance

How does a student fulfill the foreign language requirement?
A. Study abroad only
B. Complete CAS language course or prove proficiency
C. Take an AP class
D. Talk to professor
model_output: B. Complete CAS language course or prove proficiency

question:
Who can request a disciplinary hearing against a student?
A. Any student
B. Only a professor
C. Only the Dean
D. Any NYU community member

What happens to a student who withdraws from all courses mid-term?
A. Nothing
B. Automatic leave of absence
C. Academic probation
D. Transcript reviewed

Can students appeal a final grade?
A. No
B. Yes, through academic appeal process
C. Only to Registrar
D. Only in writing to Provost
model_output: B. Yes, through academic appeal process

question:
What grade must students earn in Expository Writing to fulfill the requirement?
A. A
B. B
C. C
D. D

How does a student join a cross-school minor?
A. Apply via Albert
B. Email professor
C. Follow minor school’s instructions
D. Ask Registrar
